meanings.definition: Preserve (a body) by embalming and drying it.
meanings.sent1: The ancient Egyptians were mummifying their pharaohs to keep them safe for the afterlife.
meanings.sent2: The archaeologists were mummifying the mummy they found in the tomb.
meanings.sent3: The mummifying process turned into a race against time as the desert heat increased.
meanings.sent4: The idea of mummifying memories in a photo album is like preserving a moment forever.
meanings.sent5: The mummifying of the fruit in the sun made it look like dried-up jewels.

meanings.definition: Preserve (an object) by drying and wrapping it in bandages.
meanings.sent1: She was mummifying the fragile artifact to protect it from damage.
meanings.sent2: The museum staff were mummifying the ancient scroll to prevent it from decaying.
meanings.sent3: The kids had fun mummifying their toys with toilet paper for a pretend archaeological dig.
meanings.sent4: The artist was mummifying the sculpture in layers of protective material.
meanings.sent5: The process of mummifying the book in plastic wrap kept it safe from spills and tears.

meanings.sent1: Over time, the fruit started mummifying in the dry air of the pantry.
meanings.sent2: The ancient remains were slowly mummifying in the tomb's dark chambers.
meanings.sent3: The forgotten sandwich in the lunchbox was mummifying into a science experiment.
meanings.sent4: The old documents were mummifying in the attic, untouched for decades.
meanings.sent5: The abandoned house was mummifying in the overgrown garden, becoming a relic of the past.
